name: Holiday Inn Express Houston-Downtown Convention Center

reviews.title: Nice for the price...
reviews.text: Just went on a trip with friends in Sept. 2006 and this Holiday Inn Express is nice just like most of them are. The front desk was helpful and kind, and the rooms were nice and cool in the hot Texas weather. Nothing much to complain about except for the people who try and hit you up in the parking lot for money.
Alos, the continental breakfast, just like all of them was below average. I suppose if you can function off of a glass of pulpy orange juice and a bannana your good to go.
reviews.title: We'll Be Back!!!
Nice place, very convenient to Toyota Centger
Horrible
reviews.text: If you are looking for a hotel within walking distance of Minute Maid Park and/or the Convention Center, this is the one! Free parking, a continental breakfast, clean comfortable rooms (with the luxurious upgraded bedding!) and the reasonable rate cannot be beat. Oh, did I mention how friendly and accomodating the front desk personnel and breakfast attendants were? They aimed to please. We will definitely return to this hotel the next time we are in Houston to attend a ball game.

You can't beat this place especially if you have plans to attend a game or event at the Toyota Center. The Convention Center and Minute Maid Park are also within an easy walk. Great downtown location with bargain pricing. It's going to be our "home away from home" when we have a need to be in downtown Houston.
reviews.title: Great hotel and free parking!!
loved the location, free breakfast and internet
reviews.text: I was in Houston for the NCAA Finals in Fencing. The Location was excellent very close to the George Brown Convention Center, much less than the Hilton Hotel of America which was one block away. The staff was helpful the breakfast was good not great, but adequate. The pool was very small and was always used by families with children. It did not look clean.

reviews.title: Baseball Fan
reviews.text: The room was a good size with 2 double beds. There was a crack in the floor tile in the bathroom, but it did not bother me since the room felt clean. The access to one computer was great as long as no one else was using it. It was free access and I printed my boarding pass from their computer. The front desk gave great advice for restaurants. I would go back if another event came up at the convention center.

aka: Holiday Inn Express Houston-Downtown Hotel Houston
description: Why stay anywhere else? Make The Holiday Inn Express Hotel and Suites Convention Center your first choice for your next trip to Houston, Texas. Located in beautiful downtown Houston one block from the Houston Toyota Center, Houston Rockets headquarters, and two blocks from the Houston Convention Center, Houston s biggest convention center. Astros fan? We are just 0.5 miles from Minute Maid Park and the Astros, 2 miles from the University of Houston, 3 miles from the Texas Medical Center, and 6 miles from Reliant Stadium. The Holiday Inn Express is within a mile of Exxon-Mobile, Chevron, Shell, Meridian, Lyondell, Planned Parent Hood, as well as restaurants and the Houston Theater District.In a hurry? Stop by our complimentary hot breakfast bar and pick up a warm cinnamon roll or a biscuit with gravy, or you can pick from our other favorite selections. Whether you are traveling to Houston for business or leisure our hotel accommodation has all of the must have amenities you expect and more: free parking, large heated pool, business center, fitness center, free wireless Internet access, ATM on site. Enjoy spacious guest rooms, incredibly friendly employees and service. We are sure that on your next trip, you will make Holiday Inn Express Hotel and Suites your first choice.
